stories.title: Facebook and Anti-Abortion Clinics Are Collecting Info on Would-Be Patients

stories.text: Recently I've found it very hard to get anything done at work. I'm very uninterested in any of the work we do and sooner or later not contributing will be a problem. How do I push myself to get stuff done? Doesn't even need to be super productive - getting 2-3 good hours of work a day would be a great start.
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you motivate yourself to work?

stories.text:
The idea of time blocking or time chunking is simple. It essentially boils down to blocking some period on your calendar to do a particular task. For example, if you are interested in photography, you can block off 2 hours on every Sunday (bi-weekly) for photography.

Upon successful implementation, you might notice relief from that constant feeling of not having time for your hobby or doing something you are interested. It's because now you have guaranteed time. It's like a time-insurance thing! You can increase or decrease the time according to your need. Having this insurance relieves a lot of negative feelings about not being productive or not being able to do things you are interested in.

Give it a try!
stories.title: Tell HN: If you are bored because of your job, try time blocking
